meanings.sent1: She grabs the ball before it falls.
meanings.sent2: He grabs his backpack and rushes out the door.
meanings.sent3: The cat grabs the toy mouse and runs around the room.
meanings.sent4: Time grabs hold of us and never lets go.
meanings.sent5: The wind grabs the leaves and swirls them in the air.

meanings.definition: A sudden attempt to seize or grasp
meanings.sent1: His grab for the last cookie was unsuccessful.
meanings.sent2: The child's grab at the butterfly was gentle.
meanings.sent3: The monkey's grab for the banana was comical.
meanings.sent4: Her grab for attention was met with laughter.
meanings.sent5: The eagle's grab of the fish was swift and precise.

meanings.definition: To take or grasp something quickly and roughly
meanings.sent1: He grabs the rope and pulls himself up.
meanings.sent2: She grabs the book from the shelf and starts reading.
meanings.sent3: The toddler grabs the crayons and scribbles on the wall.
meanings.sent4: Emotions can grab us unexpectedly and shake us.
meanings.sent5: The storm grabs the trees and bends them in its fury.
